summary: EPA's National Priorities List sites are some of the most contaminated places in the country. They may pose unique challenges for Indian tribes. For example, toxic substances in 2 New York rivers pose a threat to one tribe’s health and its subsistence lifestyle, which includes fishing. EPA has a policy to consult with tribes if its efforts to deal with these sites may affect them...
title: Superfund: EPA Should Improve the Reliability of Data on National Priorities List Sites Affecting Indian Tribes
